oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sam Houston giving order
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Engraving showing Sam Houston (1793-1863) and Hockley. Both men seated in a cabin. Houston has legs outstretch and wears a long cape, and Hockley sits with legs crossed, writing on a paper. Hockley wears a hate and mustache. Houston's hat on the floor. Image 16 of 16 in folder. From The Raven: A Biography of Sam Houston. On the Retreat from Gonzales. Houston dictating to Hockley the order for Major Austin to go in search of artillery (From 'Sam Houston and His Republic' 1846)
Original print from Sam Houston and His Republic, 1846.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Houston, Sam, 1793-1863
Houston, Sam, 1793-1863;Tennessee. Governor;Texas. President (1841-1844 : Houston)
